alert.note: Alert for Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 9:59AM EST until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by previous excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of West Central Ohio, including the following county, Greene. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 959 AM EST, local law enforcement reported flooding and high water lingering across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Kettering, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Xenia, Bellbrook, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, Cedarville, Jamestown, Wilberforce, New Jasper, Spring Valley, Bowersville, Clifton, Centerville, Oldtown, Trebein, Greene County Airport and John Bryan State Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
